intro: Aciphylla townsonii, commonly known as the Stewart Island pincushion, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a pincushion-like appearance. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and are pollinated by insects. Aciphylla townsonii is adapted to withstand strong winds and salt spray, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
